description.p: The elves of Thedas are a slender, agile people whose history is marked by loss and subjugation. Once an immortal race connected to powerful magic, they now live much shorter lives, and their heritage is divided between the urban City Elves and the nomadic Dalish Elves.
Your elf character has a variety of natural abilities, the result of thousands of years of elven refinement.
Ability Score Increase. Your Dexterity score increases by 2.
Age.Elves mature at the same rate as humans and rarely live longer than 70 to 80 years.
Size.Elves are shorter and more slender than humans, standing between 5 and 5'6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Keen Sight You have proficiency in the Perception skill.
Drawn to the Fade You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Common.

Subrace.The elven people are scattered and lost seperated now into two distinct groups city elfs raised within human cities and human cukture and dalish elfs wanderers sworn to remeber there ancestors and the ancient elves that came before them

City Elves live in human-dominated settlements, often confined to alienages. Generations of oppression have made them resilient and resourceful, but many dream of freedom and dignity.
Ability Score Increase. Your Constitution score increases by 1.
Streetwise.You are proficient in the Insight skill, reflecting your ability to navigate social situations and detect lies.
Enduring Spirit.Your years of enduring hardship have hardened you. When you roll a saving throw against being frightened or paralyzed, you can roll with advantage.
Urban Adaptation.You are proficient in one tool and one weapon of your choice that reflects your life in the city, such as thieves' tools or a simple melee weapon like a club or dagger.

Dalish Elves are nomadic, fiercely protective of their traditions, and deeply connected to nature. They travel in small clans, preserving what remains of their culture and the old ways.
Ability Score Increase. Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Natural Explorer.You gain proficiency in the Survival skill. Additionally, when traveling in forests, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
Dalish Weapon Training.You have proficiency with the longbow, shortbow, and scimitar.

Spirit Touched.You know the druidcraft cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the hunter's mark spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
Perserver of Lore.You can speak, read, and write Elvhen, the ancient language of the elves, passed down through Dalish oral tradition.
